# performSegue(forRow:)

**Instance Method**

Performs the segue for the specified row.

## Declaration

```swift
func performSegue(forRow row: Int)
```

## Parameters

- **row**: The index of the row.

## Discussion

This method lets you programmatically transition to a new interface controller. It triggers the segue defined in your storyboard file for the specified row controller.

While similar to the [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKInterfaceController] class’s [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKInterfaceController/pushController(withName:context:)] method, this method supports Item Pagination . If Item Pagination is enabled, you must use this method when programmatically navigating through a table’s hierarchy. For more information on Item Pagination, see [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKInterfaceTable#Support-Item-Pagination].
